content.description: Sit start with a pair of opposing sidepull jugs. From there, work around the shallow roof onto the northwest face of the arete, gain good footing, make stand up big to a great edge, and finish up the remaining jugs to reach an easy finish.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is perfect though.
content.location: It climbs the northwest arete of Punchdance.

content.description:
Start low on a good shelf, and move up and left. There is a crux midway moving through the undercling/sidepull combo. It is an incredible problem.

Footage of my ripped pants ascent

vimeo.com/162232303
content.location: This ascends the Northeast side of the boulder.

content.description:
This is a harder start to the amazing problem

Punchdance

.

Sit start left of

Punchdance

on a crimp used as a foot for the original line and a good hand underneath, and move into

Punchdance

.
content.protection: A couple of pads and a spotter.

content.description:
This is a surprisingly fun problem. Start low with a right hand on the foot of

Dynomosity

and a left hand next to it. The first move is big to the jug hueco or use a small, intermediate crimp.
Start with your hands and a heel on the rail, then move right to a sandy hold before heading up and over the lip on good jugs.
content.protection: A couple of pads, it has a pretty good landing.
content.location:
It is in the same alcove as

Stand-Up Comedy

, just on the opposite boulder.

content.description: Dynomosity is a really interesting problem. Start on a good shelf, head out to a slopey hold, and the make the big move to two good slopers. This move will be harder for shorter people.
content.protection: A few pads, there's a rock that needs to be covered up.
content.location:
It is left ten or so feet from

Punchdance

.
